Package be.ac.umons.jsonschematools.generator.exploration

Class ChoicesSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.ac.umons.jsonschematools.generator.exploration.ChoicesSequence
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Choice>
    public class ChoicesSequence
extends Object
implements Iterable<Choice>
    A finite sequence of choices. When exploring the possibilities described by a schema, multiple choices must be done in a row. This class stores these choices in a sequential order. It is possible to iterate over the choices starting from the first choice, to add new choices, and to remove choices.
    Author:
    GaÃ«tan Staquet

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChoicesSequence

        public ChoicesSequence()

    • Method Detail

      • createNewChoice

        public Choice createNewChoice​(int nPossibilities,
                              boolean exclusive)

      • removeAllChoicesComingAfter

        public void removeAllChoicesComingAfter​(Choice choice)
        Remove all the choices that are after the given choice. That is, the given choice become the last choice in the sequence. If the given choice is not present in the sequence, the function throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException.
        Parameters:
        choice - The choice that must be the last in the sequence.

      • popLastChoice

        public void popLastChoice()
        Remove the last choice in the sequence. If the sequence is empty, throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException.

      • containsChoiceWithNextValue

        public boolean containsChoiceWithNextValue()
        Checks whether the sequence contains a choice that has a value not yet explored.
        Returns:
        True if there is a choice that can take a new value in the sequence.

      • hasNextChoiceInExploration

        public boolean hasNextChoiceInExploration()
        Checks whether there is a choice already in the sequence for the current exploration of the schema. See getNextChoiceInExploration() to move forward in the exploration.
        Returns:
        True if the current choice is not the last.

      • hasUnseenValueFurtherInExploration

        public boolean hasUnseenValueFurtherInExploration()
        Checks whether there is a choice with a next value below the current choice in the exploration. See getNextChoiceInExploration() to move forward in the exploration.
        Returns:
        True if there is a choice further in the sequence with a next value.

      • removeAllChoicesAfterCurrentChoiceInExploration

        public void removeAllChoicesAfterCurrentChoiceInExploration()
        Removes all the choices that are strictly after the current choice in the exploration. See getNextChoiceInExploration() to move forward in the exploration.

      • getNextChoiceInExploration

        public Choice getNextChoiceInExploration()
        Gets the next choice for the current exploration and moves forward in the sequence. If the exploration has reached the last choice, the function throws an IndexOutOfBoundsException.
        Returns:
        The next choice.

      • iterator

        public Iterator<Choice> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface Iterable<Choice>

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object

      • getNextValueBetween

        public Integer getNextValueBetween​(int minValue,
                                   int maxValue)
        Using a Choice, gets the next possible value between minValue and maxValue (both bounds are included). If there are no other possibilities, throws a RuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        minValue - The minimal value
        maxValue - The maximal value
        Returns:
        The next possible value

      • getIndexNextExclusiveSelectionInList

        public Integer getIndexNextExclusiveSelectionInList​(int listSize)
        Gets the next possible index of a list, i.e., a number between 0 and listSize - 1.
        Parameters:
        listSize - The size of the list
        Returns:
        The next possible index

      • getBitSetNextInclusiveSelectionInList

        public BitSet getBitSetNextInclusiveSelectionInList​(int listSize,
                                                    int lengthSelection)
        Gets the next possible BitSet that represents a selection of lengthSelection elements in a list.
        Parameters:
        listSize - The size of the whole list
        lengthSelection - The number of elements to select
        Returns:
        A BitSet representing the selection

      • getChoiceForSelectionInList

        public Choice getChoiceForSelectionInList​(int listSize,
                                          boolean exclusiveChoice,
                                          boolean skipFirst)
        Gets the next possible Choice for selecting one or multiple elements in a list.
        Parameters:
        listSize - The size of the list
        exclusiveChoice - Whether one element or multiple elements can be selected at any time
        skipFirst - If true, skips the first possible value (i.e., zero)
        Returns:
        The Choice

      • getNextBooleanValue

        public Boolean getNextBooleanValue()
        Gets the next Boolean value.
        Returns:
        The next Boolean
